title: Kuching
summary: Kuching (/ˈkuːtʃɪŋ/), officially the City of Kuching,[7] is the capital and the most populous city in the state of Sarawak in Malaysia.[8] It is also the capital of Kuching Division. The city is on the Sarawak River at the southwest tip of the state of Sarawak on the island of Borneo and covers an area of 431 square kilometres (166 sq mi) with a population about 165,642 in the Kuching North administrative region and 159,490 in the Kuching South administrative region[9][10][11]—a total of 325,132 people.[9]
